p: The aforementioned results indicate that both B. zonata and S. littoralis meals could be considered a valuable source of protein and lipids for feedstuffs, but not of fibers. Moreover, it was hypothesized that the health and (more precisely) the gut health of poultry could be improved via feed containing the fiber chitin. In addition, it was suggested that the addition of antibiotics could be reduced in poultry production due to chitin-containing poultry feed [ 54, 57].
